results.title: Carburetor: principles of operation
results.brief_description: This film explains the major components of the carburetor - bore, bowl and air throttle. Also explains air pressure differential, metering, atomization and vaporization. Shows designs and devices used in carburetors.

results.title: Carbon fourteen
results.creator_credit: Warren P. Everote and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains the use of radioactive carbon as a means of determining the age of historic and prehistoric objects; shows how carbon fourteen is being used in studying the process of photosynthesis; and describes experiments at the Argonne National Laboratory, near Chicago, which are being conducted to study the effect of atomic radiation on plant growth.

results.title: Carbon content
results.creator_credit: Robin Cantelon, Frank A. Hoare and British Iron and Steel Federation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Structure and Properties of Steel”.
In steel, carbon exists as a chemical compound with iron, known as cementite. The distribution of cementite and ferrite, or pure iron, governs grain structure. The film shows how this distribution is affected when the steel is heated and cooled

results.brief_description: Explains the principles of CO2, absorption techniques, and demonstrates two methods in use: Single-phase absorption and closed circuit or double-phase absorption.

results.title: Carbon
results.creator_credit: Peter De Normanville and Anthony Gilkison Associates
results.brief_description: Shows the various forms of carbon and the familiar uses of such substances as diamond, pencil lead and charcoal. Surveys the everyday uses of carbon, both in the house and in industry, and touches on the development of pyrographite and carbon fibres. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Caravaners
results.creator_credit: George Johnson, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The three-hundred Airstream caravans that are prowling the highways of British Columbia represent a new breed of nomad. Too active just to sit at home but too cautious to strike out on their own, these retired couples have signed up for an organized caravan tour sponsored by the company that manufactures the trailers. Few surprises are in store for the group, but then they’re never alone and they don’t have to worry about the day’s route or entertainment.

results.title: Caravan park
results.brief_description: Caravan Park is filmed both from the point of view of a small child and from an observer. A family of three is stranded in a caravan park when their car breaks down on the road home. A stray cat found near the car is taken as a good luck sign by the father and adopted by his son. As the family continues to struggle to make ends meet and get back on the road, the cat continues to be a sign of good luck for the father, until it dies. This is a slow paced narrative and requires careful examination of the characters to understand its purpose.

results.title: Caravaggio
results.brief_description: As influential Italian artist Caravaggio dies in exile in 1610, he recalls his short life, from his childhood to his initial artistic failures to his later triumphs as he catches the eye of a sympathetic cardinal to his destructive relationship with a dashing gambler.

constellations_other.name: Sandy, Swinton, Shakespeare and Derek
constellations_other.description: Tracing costume designer Sandy Powell's ongoing connections with Tilda Swinton, William Shakespeare and Derek Jarman.

results.description: As influential Italian artist Caravaggio dies in exile in 1610, he recalls his short life, from his childhood to his initial artistic failures to his later triumphs as he catches the eye of a sympathetic cardinal to his destructive relationship with a dashing gambler.

results.title: Caravaggio
results.creator_credit: Derek Jarman, Sarah Radclyffe and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: An imaginary biopic of the Italian painter who died in 1610. Caravaggio was the last, perhaps the greatest, and certainly the most controversial painter of the Italian Renaissance. While Caravaggio’s paintings reflect an increasingly profound and original awareness, his private life was fraught with prostitutes, brawls, duels, arrests and libel cases, culminating in 1606 with a murder. Caravaggio’s bisexuality, his propensity for violence, and his scorn for court conventions made him the scoundrel of the Italian aristocracy.
